title: Create consoul-cli package depending on SDK
description:
**As a** CLI user
**I want** consoul-cli package that depends on consoul-sdk
**So that** CLI can be installed independently with minimal dependencies

**Context:**
After consoul-sdk package exists (SOUL-260), create separate CLI package that depends on it. This enables users who only want CLI to install without TUI overhead.

**Package Contents:**
- consoul.cli (chat_session, approval, input, etc.)
- consoul.commands (CLI commands)
- consoul.__main__ (entry point)

**Dependencies:**
- consoul-sdk (required, from PyPI)
- Click (required)
- Rich (required for CLI rendering)
- NO Textual (excluded)

**Technical Notes:**
- Create: packages/consoul-cli/pyproject.toml
- Create: packages/consoul-cli/src/consoul_cli/
- Move: CLI code from main project
- Depend: consoul-sdk package
- Setup: Entry point for consoul command
- Publish: To PyPI as consoul-cli
- Dependencies: SOUL-260 (consoul-sdk package)

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** SDK package published (SOUL-260)
**When** I pip install consoul-cli
**Then** CLI and SDK are installed (no TUI)

**Given** CLI installed
**When** I run consoul chat
**Then** CLI works using SDK services

**Given** CLI package
**When** Checking dependencies
**Then** Textual is not required

**Given** Installation size
**When** Installing consoul-cli
**Then** Package is smaller than full consoul

**Implementation Hints:**
- Depend on consoul-sdk>=1.0.0
- Use Click for CLI framework
- Keep Rich for CLI rendering (not SDK)
- Update CLI to import from consoul_sdk
- Setup console_scripts entry point
- Test CLI independently
- Document CLI-only installation
- Version independently

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Closed as won't-do-now. Decision: Keep monorepo with optional extras instead of splitting packages.

Rationale:
- Development velocity more important than install size
- Simpler versioning and testing
- No evidence yet that server-only usage >> CLI/TUI
- Optional extras provide same benefit: pip install consoul[server]

See EPIC-014 description for full decision rationale and criteria for reconsidering.

Alternative approach implemented via:
- EPIC-016: Production SDK within monorepo
- EPIC-017: consoul.server module (not separate package)
- pyproject.toml optional extras for minimal installs
